unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Gas Cylinder Prices Remain a Hot Topic!**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities: Gas Cylinder Prices Remain a Hot Topic!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, chai pe charcha is definitely going to include gas cylinder prices this week! Subsidised LPG cylinder rates are still pinching pockets, with no relief announced by Indane or Bharat Gas so far this month.
normalised: Hey folks, chai pe charcha is definitely going to include gas cylinder prices this week! Subsidized L P G cylinder rates are still pinching pockets, with no relief announced by Indane or Bharat Gas so far this month.

unnormalised: Rumours were flying around that a big drop was coming after Diwali, but *koi nahin aaya*. Last we checked, a cylinder in Delhi was still costing around Rs. 1100, give or take a few rupees depending on your distributor and whether you're arguing with Sharmaji downstairs again.
normalised: Rumours were flying around that a big drop was coming after Diwali, but *koi nahin aaya*. Last we checked, a cylinder in Delhi was still costing around rupee one thousand one hundred, give or take a few rupees depending on your distributor and whether you're arguing with Sharmaji downstairs again.

unnormalised: Analysts at ICICI Securities are saying global factors are to blame (surprise, surprise!), specifically citing the ongoing issues in Ukraine.
normalised: Analysts at I C I C I Securities are saying global factors are to blame (surprise, surprise!), specifically citing the ongoing issues in Ukraine.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Dr. Verma from JNU believes government intervention is needed to ease the burden on common households, especially in places like Bihar where cooking fuel options are limited. He estimates many families are cutting back on other essentials to afford gas.
normalised: Meanwhile, Doctor Verma from J N U believes government intervention is needed to ease the burden on common households, especially in places like Bihar where cooking fuel options are limited. He estimates many families are cutting back on other essentials to afford gas.

unnormalised: On a slightly brighter note, there's talk of increased CNG availability in Mumbai, aiming to cover more areas than just the Bandra-Worli Sea Link stretch, offering a cheaper alternative for auto-rickshaws operating within a 5 sq ft radius. But that doesn't help with rotis, does it? Keep your eyes peeled for updates, folks!
normalised: On a slightly brighter note, there's talk of increased C N G availability in Mumbai, aiming to cover more areas than just the Bandra-Worli Sea Link stretch, offering a cheaper alternative for auto-rickshaws operating within a five square foot radius. But that doesn't help with rotis, does it? Keep your eyes peeled for updates, folks!
